total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is always 6 rows and 4 columns, regardless of the size of the input grid.
Q3: Identify the role of the number 7 in the input grid. It seems to act as a separator between the top and bottom halves of the grid.
Q4: Identify the transformation rules for the numbers 2 and 6 in the input grid. In the output grid, some 2s in the input grid are transformed into 8s, and all 6s are removed.
Q5: Determine the specific conditions under which a 2 in the input grid is transformed into an 8 in the output grid.
Q6: Notice that the position of 8 in the output grid seems to be related to the position of 2 in the input grid above the row of 7s.
Q7: Formulate a rule to generate the output grid based on the observations from Q1 to Q6.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is always 6 rows and 4 columns, regardless of the size of the input grid.
Q3: Identify the role of the number 7 row in the input grid.
Q4: Notice that the output grid is a transformation of the rows above the number 7 row in the input grid.
Q5: Identify the transformation rule from the number 2 and 0 in the input grid to the number 8 and 0 in the output grid.
Q6: Apply the transformation rule to the rows above the number 7 row in the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
